intro: Oenanthe glauca, commonly known as blue water-dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as stream banks and wet meadows. Oenanthe glauca is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
